p: The antioxidant activity, expressed as the iron reduction of ferric ion, indicated that EO is the best antioxidant agent with 136.07 mg of AAE/g, followed by EOH (26.10 mg equivalent of ascorbic acid (AAE/g)) extract. Teixeira reported a lower reducing power of O. vulgare EO (74.5 Î¼mol AAE/g) [ 31] than what we present here. On the other hand, the EAc and non-polar extracts presented a similar reducing power activity, while the polar subfractions had the lowest antioxidant values for this test.
